articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance of State Merited Chorus
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance of State Merited Chorus
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il enjoyed a performance given by the State Merited Chorus on the occasion of the lunar New Year.
					 When he appeared in the auditorium the audience broke into the stormy cheers of "Hurrah!" and extended the warmest lunar New Year greetings to him, representing the unanimous reverence of all the servicepersons and people for him. 
					
					 He warmly congratulated them on the lunar New Year, acknowledging their enthusiastic cheers.
					
					 Among the audience were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the WPK Central Committee, Jang Song Thaek and Kim Yang Gon, department directors of the WPK Central Committee, Kang Sok Ju, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Je Gang and Ri Jae Il, first vice department directors of the  WPK Central Committee, Kim Ki Ryong, director general of the Korean Central News Agency, Cha Sung Su, chairman of the Central Broadcasting Committee of Korea, and other leading officials, KPA Generals Hyon Chol Hae, Kim Myong Guk and Ri Myong Su and other commanding officers of the army.
					
					 The repertoire of the performance included male chorus "Song of General Kim Jong Il", male solos and male choruses "Song of Comradeship" and "We Started from Scratch", male choruses "The Forest Sways" and "The Sound of a Horse's Hooves in Mt. Paektu", male solo and male chorus "For the Motherland" and female quartet "The Blue Sky over My Country".
					
					The performance replete with militant stamina truthfully represented the unshakable faith and will of the army and people to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche under the leadership of
						Kim Jong Il, holding higher the red flag of the revolution.
					
					 When the performance was over, he waved back to the enthusiastically cheering performers and audience and congratulated the artistes on their successful presentation. 
					
					 Greatly satisfied with the splendid performance reflecting the faith and will of Korea and the revolutionary soldier spirit given by the artistes of the State Merited Chorus, he expressed the expectation and conviction that all of them would conduct dynamic revolutionary art activities and thus fully display the might of buglers in the Songun era in the worthwhile drive in the new year, too.

articles.title: Floral Baskets Placed before Statues of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Floral Baskets Placed before Statues of Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- Servicepersons of the Korean People's Army and people from all walks of life visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung in different parts of the country to pay homage to him on the occasion of the lunar New Year. 
					 Floral baskets and flowers were placed before his statue on Mansu Hill.
					
					 Seen before the statue was a floral basket sent by General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Floral baskets and flowers were laid before his statue by officials of the party, armed forces and power bodies, social organizations, ministries, national institutions, institutions and enterprises at all levels here, servicepersons of the Korean People's Army and other people from all walks of life and school youth and children and overseas compatriots. 
					
					 Meanwhile, servicepersons of the KPA and people from all walks of life placed floral baskets and flowers before his statues in Pyongyang and local areas.

articles.title: Lunar New Year's Celebration of Schoolchildren Held
articles.content:
Lunar New Year's Celebration of Schoolchildren Held 
Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- A celebration of schoolchildren "May snow fall on lunar New Year's Day" was held at Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace on Monday on the occasion of the lunar New Year, Juche 98.
					 The palace was brightly decorated with computer-aided diorama portraying Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia, immortal flowers, magnolia, national flower of the DPRK, gate of pine decorations and others.
					
					 Appreciating the performance together with schoolchildren were senior officials of the party, the army and the state, the chairman of a friendly party, officials of the party, the armed forces and power organs, social organizations, ministries and national institutions, servicepersons of the Korean People's Army, officials in the fields of science, education, culture and arts, public health and media, persons of meritorious services and working people in Pyongyang.
					
					 Among the audience were the chief of the Pyongyang Mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front, and overseas Koreans.
					
					 Present there on invitation were diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 The schoolchildren's lunar New Year's celebration started with prelude "We Wish Fatherly Marshal Good Health."
					
					 School boys and girls extended to Marshal Kim Jong Il lunar New Year's greetings carrying their best wishes for his good health when the performers presented the song of best wishes and dances with ardent longing to see him. 
					
					Put on the stage were such colorful numbers as female solo, ensemble of national musical instruments, a series of play songs, accordion trio, dance, children's play, singing to the accompaniment of Janggu, dance and story-telling. 
					
					The performers truthfully represented the Marshal's immortal Songun revolutionary exploits and the proud feature of the schoolchildren firmly preparing themselves as pillars of the country by keeping themselves knowledgeable, virtuous and healthy.

articles.title: Concert on Lunar New Year Held
articles.content:
Concert on Lunar New Year Held
Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- A concert was held at the East Pyongyang Grand Theatre Sunday on the occasion of the lunar New Year, Juche 98.
					 Appreciating it were senior officials of the party, the army and the state, the chairman of a friendly party, officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, labor innovators and other working people in Pyongyang.
					
					 Present there on invitation were the chief of the Pyongyang Mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front, overseas Koreans on a visit to the socialist homeland, diplomatic envoys of different countries and embassy officials and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 The concert was given by artistes of the State Merited Chorus, "Unhasu", the State Symphony Orchestra, the Mansudae Art Troupe and other art troupes here.
					
					 Put on the stage were male chorus "Song of General Kim Jong Il", "The Forest Sways" and other colorful numbers.
					
					The performers sang high praises of the greatness and immortal feats of General Secretary
						Kim Jong Il who has victoriously led the revolutionary cause of Songun by successfully carrying forward and developing the revolutionary traditions of Mt. Paektu and truthfully represented the history of the sacred struggle of the Korean people adorned with victory and glory.

articles.title: Folk Games of Schoolchildren Held
articles.content:
Folk Games of Schoolchildren Held
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- Folk games of schoolchildren from across the country were held here from Jan. 22 to 26 on the occasion of the lunar New Year.
					 More than 300 schoolchildren selected from provinces competed in the games. 
					
					 Kite-flying, Korean shuttlecock and top spinning games took place at Kim Il Sung Square.
					
					 Schoolchildren rhythmically kicked shuttlecocks and spun tops in competition while the plane-, five-pointed star- and flag-shaped kites flew high in the sky, adding to the festive mood of the capital on the New Year.
					
					 Pyongyang Schoolchildren's Palace was also animated almost every day with competitors who skillfully moved pieces in such folk games as kkoni and Yut games and those who were absorbed in cat's cradle, etc. amid the enthusiastic cheering.   
					
					 The Pyongyang city team came first in team standings.

articles.title: Greetings to Australian Governor-General
articles.content:
Greetings to Australian Governor-General
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to Quentin Bryce, governor-general of Australia, on the occasion of the national day of her country.
					 Kim in the message wished her good health and happiness and the friendly government and people of Australia welfare.

articles.title: Gifts to Kim Jong Il from Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Il from Foreign Countries
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with gifts by the director of the Beijing Association for International Friendly Contact of China and a Kuwaiti company on the occasion of the February holiday.
					 They were conveyed to the ambassadors of the DPRK to the respective countries by the director of the association and Mohammed Ali, general manager of the company, on Jan. 14 and 21.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Army's Ill-boding Military Moves Flailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Army's Ill-boding Military Moves Flailed
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group is reacting to the statement issued by a spokesman for the General Staff of the Korean People's Army by staging "severe winter training" simulating an actual war by mobilizing the puppet army of south Korea these days. This is aimed to deliberately get on the nerves of the army and people of the DPRK in a bid to invent a pretext for provoking a war of aggression against it, says Minju Joson Monday in a signed commentary.
					 The commentary cites facts to prove that Lee is putting spurs to the moves to invade the north from the outset of the new year in an effort to find a way out of its crisis.
					
					 Noting that the DPRK-targeted war moves of the Lee group can be said to be a prelude to an all-out war, the commentary goes on:
					
					 A touch-and-go situation is prevailing on the Korean Peninsula due to the Lee group's moves to provoke a war of aggression against the DPRK.
					
					 This has lashed the army and people of the DPRK into great fury.
					
					 Should the puppets ignite a war of aggression against the DPRK, its revolutionary armed forces will fully display the invincible military power they have built up under the banner of Songun and mercilessly wipe out the warmongers just as they had already warned. The Lee group should stop such foolish an act as jumping into fire with faggot on its back, mindful that it would be too late for it to repent of its rash act then.

articles.title: Struggle for Toppling Puppet Regime Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Struggle for Toppling Puppet Regime Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- The Action Headquarters of the Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration to Force the Lee Myung Bak Regime to Step Down in south Korea issued a statement on January 21 calling upon people from all walks of life to turn out in the struggle to topple the puppet regime.
					 The statement stressed the need to call to task the man-killing regime and the security forces, its servants, who left inhabitants homeless in cold winter and hurled even police "commandoes" into the scene of a sit-in strike and punish them.
					
					 Accusing the Lee Myung Bak group of evading its responsibility for the incident and launching a campaign for suppressing people, the statement called for carrying on the struggle till they have driven the above-said regime to destruction.
					
					 Meanwhile, the All-People Committee for Measures against Killings of Evacuees in Ryongsan, the Association of Evacuees and other civic and public organizations of south Korea protested against the shameless act of the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors to falsify the truth about the killings of evacuees in Ryongsan.

articles.title: DPRK's Greatest Holidays to Be Marked in Egypt
articles.content:
DPRK's Greatest Holidays to Be Marked in Egypt
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- The Egyptian preparatory committee for commemorating the Day of the Sun and February 16 was inaugurated in Cairo on Jan. 18.
					 Youssef Amin Wali, vice-chairman of the National Democratic Party of Egypt, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set the period from Jan. 20 to April 16 as a commemoration period and decided to organize colorful events including a meeting, a seminar, a book and a photo exhibition and a film show in the period.

articles.title: Korean People's Cause of National Reunification Supported by Equatorial Guinean Party Leader
articles.content:
Korean People's Cause of National Reunification Supported by Equatorial Guinean Party Leader
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- Filiberto Ntutumu Nguema, general secretary of the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea, released a statement on January 14 supporting the Korean people's cause of national reunification.
					 The Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea which values the historic relations of friendship between Equatorial Guinea and the DPRK extends full support and solidarity to the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people in their struggle to achieve national reconciliation and the independent and peaceful reunification of the country, the statement said.
					
					 It held that national reconciliation and unity of Korea should be certainly achieved in line with the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration adopted between the north and the south through the struggle for shattering the obstructive moves of the anti-reunification forces.

articles.title: Rinden homenaje a Kim Il Sung por el Ano Nuevo Lunar
articles.content:
Rinden homenaje a Kim Il Sung por el Ano Nuevo Lunar
Pyongyang, 26 de enero (ATCC) -- Con motivo del Ano Nuevo Lunar 98 (2009) de la Era Juche, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y los trabajadores de distintos sectores rindieron homenaje al Presidente Kim Il Sung ante sus estatuas de bronce erguidas en esta capital y distintas localidades del pais.
					 Al pie de la estatua de bronce levantada en la capitalina colina Mansu estaba colocado un cesto de flores enviado por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					 Igualmente, fueron depositados los cestos y ramos de flores por los funcionarios de las instituciones del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, entidades sociales, ministerios, organos centrales, los organos y empresas a todos los niveles, oficiales y soldados del EPC, trabajadores, jovenes y ninos escolares en esta capital, asi como los coreanos en ultramar. 
					
					Por otra parte, fueron depositados los cestos y ramos de flores ante las estatuas de bronce del Presidente en la ciudad de Pyongyang y localidades del pais.

articles.title: Acto de ninos escolares por el Ano Nuevo Lunar
articles.content:
Acto de ninos escolares por el Ano Nuevo Lunar
Pyongyang, 26 de enero (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 26 en el capitalino Palacio de Ninos y Escolares de Mangyongdae el acto de ninos escolares para acoger el Ano Nuevo Lunar 98 (2009) de la Era Juche "Cae la nieve del Ano Nuevo".
					El palacio fue adornado elegantemente con los luminicos electricos, que muestran las flores Kimilsungia y Kimjongilia, la magnolia, flor nacional de Corea, una gran puerta ataviada con ramas del pino verde, etc.
					
					 Lo presenciaron los cuadros del partido, el ejercito y el Estado, el presidente del partido amigo, los funcionarios de los organismos del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, organizaciones sociales, ministerios y organos centrales, oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea, funcionarios de las ramas de ciencia, educacion, cultura y arte, salud publica, prensa e informacion, benemeritos, trabajadores y ninos escolares capitalinos, el representante de la Sucursal del Frente Democratico Nacional Antiimperialista en Pyongyang y coreanos en ultramar.
					
					 Entre los invitados se encontraban los representantes diplomaticos y los delegados de organizaciones internacionales, acreditados en Corea.
					
					Quedo iniciado el acto con la primera escena "Que tenga buena salud el General padre".
					
					Los ejecutantes escenificaron los cantos y bailes traduciendo su infinita anoranza al Mariscal
						Kim Jong Il y deseandole Feliz Ano Nuevo y buena salud.
					
					En la ocasion se presentaron variados programas, tales como, el solo femenino, el concierto de instrumentos musicales nacionales, la cancion en serie, el trio de acordeon, la danza, la poesia y cancion, el drama infantil, la cancion acompanada de Janggo (instrumento coreano), la danza y narracion, etc. 
					
					Los ejecutantes mostraron bien las inmortales hazanas de la revolucion del Songun (priorizacion militar)  del Dirigente Kim Jong Il y los aspectos de ellos mismos que crecen como futuros trabajadores fidedignos del pais con ricos reconocimientos, nobles virtudes y robustez fisica.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a gobernadora general de Australia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a gobernadora general de Australia
Pyongyang, 26 de enero (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 26 un mensaje de felicitacion a la gobernadora general de la Federacion Australiana, Quentin Bryce, con motivo del dia nacional de este pais.
					El remitente le desea a la destinataria buena salud y felicidad y al amistoso gobierno y pueblo australianos el bienestar.

articles.title: Minju Joson denuncia nominacion de Hyon In Thaek como ministro
articles.content:
Minju Joson denuncia nominacion de Hyon In Thaek como ministro
Pyongyang, 26 de enero (ATCC) -- El pasado dia 19, Lee Myung Bak nombro como ministro surcoreano de "Reunificacion" a Hyon In Thaek quien planteo la antinacional teoria de la "desnuclearizacion, la apertura y 3000 dolares". 
					Esto deviene desafio frontal a todos los coreanos que desean la mejora de las relaciones Norte-Sur, la reunificacion independiente, la paz y la prosperidad.
					
					Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual del dia 25 y continua:
					
					Esa nominacion demuestra las pretensiones de Lee de empeorar este ano las relaciones con el Norte ateniendose a esa "politica hacia el Norte" intitulada la "desnuclearizacion, la apertura y 3000 dolares", que rechazan todos los coreanos.
					
					Ademas, deviene abierta provocacion que declaro su voluntad de seguir enfrentandose con la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Lo que desea Lee Myung Bak no es la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas ni la preservacion de la paz ni mucho menos la reunificacion de la patria, sino alterar la actitud de la RPDC de mantener e implementar las declaraciones conjuntas Norte-Sur.
					
					De mal en peor, trata de recrudecer este ano la campana de confrontacion fratricida para llevar las relaciones entre ambas partes al abismo de enfrentamiento y bancarrota.
					
					Puesto que Hyon fue nombrado como ministro de "Reunificacion", no se puede prever cuantas catastroficas circunstancias se daran en las relaciones Norte-Sur.
					
					La banda de Lee Myung Bak, que se esfuerza desesperadamente por intensificar la confrontacion fratricida, sera condenada severamente por la nacion.
